item.title: Asian Shares Face Cautious Start as Rally Pauses: Markets Wrap
item.description: Asian equities may struggle for direction when trading opens on Thursday, tracking a flat session on Wall Street with traders assessing simmering economic and geopolitical risks.
item.dc:creator: Richard Henderson

item.title: Richard Li’s FWD Group Seeks $442 Million in Hong Kong IPO
item.description: Billionaire Richard Li’s FWD Group Holdings Ltd. is seeking to raise HK$3.5 billion ($442 million) in a Hong Kong initial public offering, seizing on a hot market to finally launch a share sale initially planned four years ago.
item.dc:creator: Julia Fioretti

media:content.media:description: Signage for FWD Group Holdings Ltd. atop a building in Hong Kong, China, on Friday, Aug. 2, 2024. Hong Kong is seeing an influx of professionals from mainland China’s finance and tech sectors who are disillusioned with their career and salary prospects across the border. Many are trying to make a living and stay in the city by peddling insurance products, giving a boost to a once-sleepy industry.

item.title: EU Strikes Deal on Failed-Lenders Rules
item.description: The European Union agreed on rules to ease winding down smaller lenders in trouble, part of an effort to bring closer banking sectors of its member states.
item.dc:creator: Lyubov Pronina

media:content.media:description: European Union (EU) flags fly near the Europa building in Brussels, Belgium, on Tuesday, Feb. 9, 2021. Ukraine is working to introduce more transparent regulation in the natural gas industry, where it also wants to strengthen links with the European Union. Photographer: Geert Vanden Wijngaert/Bloomberg

item.title: Principles of Success With Bill Belichick and Ray Dalio
item.description: Alex Rodriguez and Jason Kelly sit for a special conversation with two titans, football coach Bill Belichick and Bridgewater founder Ray Dalio, to learn their guiding principles for success. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: China’s Xiaomi to Launch First SUV as Shares Near Record High
item.description: The unveiling of Xiaomi Corp.’s first electric SUV on Thursday will showcase how the Chinese tech company has become an investor darling with its high-stakes bet on the auto market.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang

media:content.media:description: Xiaomi YU7 Photographer: CFOTO/Future Publishing/Getty Images

item.title: Circle K Owner Misses Estimates on Lower Fuel Prices, Demand
item.description: Circle K owner Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc. slightly missed earnings estimates for its fiscal fourth quarter earnings because of lower fuel demand.
item.dc:creator: Chaimae Chouiekh

media:content.media:description: A Circle K convenience store at a gas station in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, on Monday, Aug. 19, 2024. Circle K operator Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc. made a proposal to take over much larger rival and 7-Eleven owner Seven & i Holdings Co., in what would be the biggest foreign takeover of a Japanese company. Photographer: Laura Proctor/Bloomberg

item.title: Florida Shouldn't Count on a Mamdani Boom
item.description: Zohran Mamdani’s shock win has raised a lot of questions in New York City. But Bloomberg Opinion columnist Jonathan J. Levin is tackling one from Miami: Would Mamdani’s mayorship actually spark an exodus from New York to Florida? (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Stock End Mixed After Choppy Season | Closing Bell
item.description: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Scarlet Fu, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Micron Gives Strong Forecast, Lifted by AI Computing Demand
item.description: Micron Technology Inc., the largest US maker of computer memory chips, gave an upbeat forecast for the current quarter, helped by demand for artificial intelligence equipment. Fiscal fourth-quarter revenue will be roughly $10.7 billion, the company said in a statement Wednesday. That was well ahead of the $9.89 billion average analyst estimate, sending the shares up in late trading. Micron is seeing increasing demand for components like its high-bandwidth memory, which are used in machines that develop and run AI tools. The company expects continued growth from that market as such software becomes more complex, requiring bigger amounts of memory. The company is also starting to recover from narrower profit margins in the previous quarter. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Hong Kong Intervenes to Defend FX Peg as Local Currency Drops
item.description: Hong Kong’s de facto central bank bought the local dollar to prop it up on Thursday, in a move to defend the city’s currency peg to the greenback.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Zhu, Wenjin Lv

item.title: Saks in Talks for $600 Million of New Debt as Payment Nears
item.description: Just as embattled Saks Global Enterprises faces the first interest payment on debt it incurred to buy rival Neiman Marcus Group, the company is looking to tap investors for even more funding.
item.dc:creator: Reshmi Basu, Eliza Ronalds-Hannon, Jill R Shah, Jeannette Neumann

media:content.media:description: A Neiman Marcus store in Garden City, New York, US, on Friday, July 5, 2024. The owner of Saks Fifth Avenue is acquiring Neiman Marcus Group for $2.65 billion, a deal that will unite America's two largest high-end department-store chains in a bid to grab a bigger share of a slowing industry.

item.title: Enbridge Says New Canadian Oil Pipeline Would Require Legal Changes First
item.description: Enbridge Inc. said any new Canadian oil pipeline would require legislative changes, including shortened timelines for approval.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Orland

media:content.media:description: Inspectors take measurements after an approximately one-mile long string of pipeline was lowered into a trench during construction of the Flanagan South crude oil pipeline outside Goodfield, Illinois, U.S., on Tuesday, Oct. 8, 2013. The approximately 600-mile, 36-inch crude oil pipeline is being constructed by Enbridge Energy Co., a subsidiary of Enbridge Inc., Canada's largest oil transporter, and will originate in Flanagan, Illinois and terminate in Cushing, Oklahoma. Photographer: Daniel Acker

item.title: Envision Healthcare Inks Debt Deal with Lenders Amid Turnaround
item.description: Envision Healthcare Corp. agreed to a deal with its lenders that will cut the company’s borrowing costs in the midst of a turnaround for the business.
item.dc:creator: Jill R Shah, Reshmi Basu

item.title: Treasury Yield Curve Steepens as Traders Boost Bets on Fed Cuts
item.description: Shorter-term Treasuries outperformed in a volatile session Wednesday that saw traders continuing to boost wagers that the Federal Reserve will lower interest rates in coming months.
item.dc:creator: Ye Xie

item.title: The Waning Ambitions of China’s $1.3 Trillion Fund Giant
item.description: China’s $1.3 trillion sovereign wealth fund spent years as one of the most sought-after investors in the world. It owned massive stakes in Blackstone Inc. and Morgan Stanley, struck deals with Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and plowed tens of billions of dollars into funds across Wall Street.

item.title: California Reaches $321 Billion Budget Deal Boosting Hollywood
item.description: California Governor Gavin Newsom and state lawmakers struck a budget agreement that provides $750 million in tax credits for Hollywood while scaling back free health care for undocumented immigrants.
item.dc:creator: Eliyahu Kamisher, Andrew Oxford

media:content.media:description: Gavin Newsom, governor of California, speaks during a news conference in Sacramento, California, U.S., on Tuesday, April 14, 2020. Newsom outlined his plan to lift restrictions in the most-populous U.S. state, saying a reopening depends on meeting a series of benchmarks that would remake daily life for 40 million residents.

item.title: What Micron’s Upbeat Forecast Signals for Tech Stocks
item.description: Kim Forrest, Bokeh Capital Partners founder and CIO, reacts to Micron’s upbeat forecast on “Bloomberg The Close.” Micron said fiscal fourth-quarter revenue will be roughly $10.7 billion, well ahead of the $9.89 billion average analyst estimate.

item.title: Vista Raises $5.6 Billion for Cloud Software Continuation Fund
item.description: Vista Equity Partners gathered $5.6 billion in order to keep Cloud Software Group for longer, tapping its own buyout funds and new investors to seal a blockbuster single-asset continuation fund, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
item.dc:creator: Allison McNeely, Laura Benitez, Preeti Singh

media:content.media:description: Citrix headquarters in Santa Clara, California.

item.title: Lenders Find a Fast-Growing Market in Foreign Grad Students
item.description: Some startups take a broader view of grads’ ability to repay, looking to job prospects as support for lending.
item.dc:creator: Robb Mandelbaum

item.title: US Ranchers Finally Moving to Increase Cattle Supplies, JBS Says
item.description: US ranchers are moving to expand their herds from a seven-decade low, paving the way for a long-awaited recovery in beef supplies, according to top producer JBS NV.
item.dc:creator: Gerson Freitas Jr

media:content.media:description: Cattle at an export/import livestock crossing in Santa Teresa, New Mexico.

item.title: S&P 500 Rally Hits a Wall Near Its All-Time Highs: Markets Wrap
item.description: Wall Street’s rally is showing some signs of fatigue on speculation stocks have run too far amid economic and geopolitical risks. Longer-term Treasuries underperformed. Oil bounced from its biggest two-day plunge since 2022. The dollar fell to a three-year low.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

media:content.media:description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell reiterated to lawmakers that the central bank is in no rush to lower interest rates while waiting for more clarity on the economic impact of President Donald Trump’s tariffs. “For the time being, we are well positioned to wait to learn more about the likely course of the economy before considering any adjustments to our policy stance,” Powell said Tuesday in remarks before the House Financial Services Committee.

item.title: Nasdaq 100 Ekes Out Another Record While S&P 500’s Climb Stalls
item.description: The US stocks rally lost some steam Wednesday with the S&P 500 Index ending the day flat after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell told lawmakers that officials are struggling to determine the toll of tariffs on inflation.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Semenova

item.title: Mamdani’s Rent-Freeze Agenda Sparks Slide in NYC-Linked REITs
item.description: Shares of companies linked to New York City real estate fell Wednesday as Zohran Mamdani, a state Assembly member who has vowed to freeze rents, looks all but certain to become the Democratic nominee for mayor.
item.dc:creator: Norah Mulinda, Georgie McKay, Natalie Wong

media:content.media:description: Zohran Mamdani, New York City mayoral candidate, during an election night event in New York, US, early on Wednesday, June 25, 2025. More than 930,000 New Yorkers cast their ballots in the city's Democratic primary, with more than half withstanding record temperatures to vote at polling stations on Tuesday.

item.title: Mamdani’s Shock Win Has Wall Street Fretting Over ‘Hot Commie Summer’
item.description: Even Zohran Mamdani’s detractors recognize that the vibes are with the 33-year-old democratic socialist.
item.dc:creator: Sridhar Natarajan, Laura Nahmias

media:content.media:description: Zohran Mamdani during a campaign event in New York, on June 23.

item.title: NYC Democrats Back Mamdani Over Cuomo | Bloomberg Markets 6/25/2025
item.description: "Bloomberg Markets" follows the market moves across every global asset class and discusses the biggest issues for Wall Street. Today's guests; Goldman Sachs Group Vice Chairman Robert Kaplan, Bloomberg's Laura Nahmias, Nir Kaissar, Cailley LaPara, Carmen Arroyo, and Simon Casey. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trump’s World Liberty Token Draws Accumulators’ Attention, Co-Founder Says
item.description: World Liberty Financial Inc., the Trump family affiliated decentralized finance platform, is getting a “lot of interest” from public companies wanting to use its token as a treasury asset, according to co-founder Zak Folkman.
item.dc:creator: Kirk Ogunrinde

item.title: Oil Gains as US Stockpiles Drop, Trump Sticks to Iran Pressure
item.description: Oil drifted higher after the biggest two-day decline since 2022 as President Donald Trump downplayed the prospects of near-term sanctions relief for Iran and a government report showed a large drop in US crude stockpiles.
item.dc:creator: Mia Gindis, Alex Longley

media:content.media:description: The LyondellBasell Houston refinery in Houston, Texas, US, on Monday June 23, 2025. Efforts to de-escalate the Middle East conflict spurred a selloff in oil, easing concerns about inflation and driving stocks higher on hopes the Federal Reserve will have room to cut rates despite Jerome Powell's wait-and-see signals.

item.title: Small City in Washington State Files Rare Bankruptcy Over Developer Dispute
item.description: A small city in Washington State filed a rare municipal bankruptcy after failing to reach an agreement with a developer over a $26 million court judgment.
item.dc:creator: Martin Z Braun

media:content.media:description: The Kittitas Valley in Eastern Washington near Cle Elum, Washington.

item.title: Shell Says It Isn't in Talks to Take Over Oil Rival BP
item.description: Bloomberg's Will Hares breaks down chatter around oil company Shell, after it denied a Wall Street Journal report it was interest in talks to take over rival BP. Hares says that despite the denial, there could be some future for a smaller deal between the companies. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Euro’s Rally Faces Inflection Point as It Moves Toward $1.20
item.description: The euro’s latest rally is approaching a pivotal level that could either stall its momentum or unlock the next leg toward $1.20, a target strategists and traders have circled for months.
item.dc:creator: Vassilis Karamanis

media:content.media:description: A customer pays with euro banknotes in Bremen, Germany. Photographer: Krisztian Bocsi/Bloomberg
